ARABIC: إِنَّهُمْ إِن يَظْهَرُوا۟ عَلَيْكُمْ يَرْجُمُوكُمْ أَوْ يُعِيدُوكُمْ فِى مِلَّتِهِمْ وَلَن تُفْلِحُوٓا۟ إِذًا أَبَدًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: for if they find out about you they will stone you or make you revert to their religion and then you will never have success.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: If they come to know of you they will stone you to death, or force you to go back to their creed; then you will never succeed."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: For if they should come upon us, they will stone us to death or force us to revert to their faith whereafter we shall never prosper."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: they would certainly stone us to death or force us to follow their religion. Then we shall never be able to have everlasting happiness."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Indeed if they come to know about you, they will stone you or turn you back to their religion – and if so, you will never prosper.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: For, if they come to know of you, they will stone you or turn you back to their religion; and in that case you will never be successful."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: For surely if they prevail against you they would stone you to death or force you back to their religion, and then you will never succeed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: If they should get knowledge of you they will stone you, or restore you to their creed, then you will not prosper ever.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: For they, if they should come to know of you, will stone you or turn you back to their religion; then ye will never prosper.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: for if they find you out, they will stone you to death, or force you back into their faith. In that case you would never prosper."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily they, if they come to know of you, would stone you or make you revert to their faith, and lo! then ye will never fare well.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed should they prevail over you, they will [either] stone you [to death], or force you back into their creed, and then you will never be saved. ’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: For if they should come upon you, they would stone you or force you to return to their cult, and in that case ye would never attain prosperity."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: For if they come to know of you, they will stone you (to death or abuse and harm you) or turn you back to their religion, and in that case you will never be successful."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: For, if they appear in front of you, they will stone you to death or restore you to their religion. Then you will never prosper'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “If they discover you, they will stone you, or force you back into their religion; then you will never be saved.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, if they come to know of you, they will stone you or return you to their religion. And never would you succeed, then - ever."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [18:20] For indeed if they should come to know of you, they will [either] stone you, kill you by stoning, or make you return to their creed, and then, if you do return to their creed, you will never prosper’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (For they, if they) the Magians (should come to know of you, will stone you) kill you (or turn you back to their religion) Zoroastrianism; (then ye will never prosper) you will never escape from Allah's punishment.
